H0.text: More protons than neutrons is the characteristic that best describes a neutral atom.

H1.text: A neutral atom is best described as having more electrons than protons.

H2.text: An equal number of protons and neutrons is what best describes a neutral atom.

H3.text: An equal number of protons and electrons is what best describes a neutral atom.

A4.text: If the numbers of protons and electrons are equal, as they normally are, then the atom is electrically neutral as a whole.

A5.text: Atoms are electrically neutral if they have an equal number of protons and electrons.
